result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin R. Gibbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be collected through ES on 15cf266

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin R. Gibbs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF212 - Court sentences to WSP for  Count 1 is 3 years WSP - 1/5 in/ 2 years ES CC
Count 3 - 4 years - 2 years in/2 years ES -   Credit for 256 days  Costs waived

15cf265 -  Count 1 - 9 months CC - costs waived
Count 2- 4 years - 2 years in/2 years ES - Rest 761 total - costs waived

15cf266-Count 1 - Court sentences to 3 1/2 years - WSP - 1.5 in/ 2 years ES -  Count 2 6 years - 4 in/2 ES - - Credit for 62 days 
Conditions of ES - Costs wavied /DNA surcharge/Submit DNA sample- Restitution Count 2 of $8145.50 total and $440 Count 3 

16CF53 - Court imposes fine/costs $150.00
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights/Voting Rights/WEDS given to defendant - 

In regards to 15 cases owed- Court converts to civil judgments -
PSI distributed to parties, DA, Attorney Richards and Judge O'Melia

Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:48
Calling 15cf150,15cf175,15cf212,15cf265,15cf266, 16cf53 and 11 TR/FO cases set for review with balance due of 3107.90
Sowinski reads summary of agreement - Court questions the 199 days 
15cf150 - State moves to amend to 4th degree SA - 940.225(3m) 
15cf175 - State moves to dismiss but read in - 
15cf212 - State moves to dismiss but read counts 3--7 -
15cf265 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 3 and 4
15cf266 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 1 and 4 - and dismiss repeater enhancer in counts 2 and 3 - 
VIctim rights have been complied with -
Motions granted by Court
Plea questionnaire filed for each case - Defendant pleads no contest to amended count 1 in 15cf150, counts 1 and 2 in 15cf212, Counts 1 and 2 in 15cf265, Counts 2 and 3 w/o repeater in 15cf266 and 16cf53 as charged -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Court orders PSI - 
Court remands defendant at this time - Richards statement - 
Court orders 120 days jail on 15cf150-  commence today-  - CC/CV -reivew date to be provided at next court date
SUmmary marked and received as exhibit 1  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 10:45 am.

11:11 a.m. Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in court with attorney Steven Richards.  Mary Margaret Sowinski, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CF175, 15CF150, 15CF265, 15CF212, 16CF53, 15CF266, 16CF53, 15CF266, 14FO971, 14TR1047, 14TR1165, 14TR1046, 14TR1657, 15FO659, 14TR1543, 14TR1606, 15TR1486. Attorney Steven Richards notifies the court he will be assigned to all pending cases; waiting for public defender appointment/he has not seen paperwork; expects global resolution. Requests adjournment. Sowinski statement. 16CF53 - defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary, binds defendant over. Richards in receipt of Information, pleads not guilty. Defendant advises he will begin making payments next week/will be reviewed at time of PTC. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:51 p.m. Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in court, via video, in custody, with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -Court reserves Defendant's rights to preliminary hearing. 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:53 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

1:42 p.m. Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant is represented by Attorney Snyder, Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig  bond. Adj. 1:45 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
